page.title: 15Culcheth Sewage Works
page.content: The sewage works takes sewage from Lowton, Culcheth and Glazebury. It can handle 30,000 cubic metres of sewage a day. There are computers so three men operate all the machinary. Screw pumps lift the sewage from the sewers. Screening gets out paper and cloths etc. The sewage goes into the settling tanks and all the sludge sinks to the bottom. Sludge pumps deep under the ground pump out the sludge into tanks. Next the sewage goes through a bed of stones, and worms and bacteria break down any organic matter. The water is now clean enough to into the River Glaze. Small hills have been made and trees have been planted to improve the look of the works. There is only a smell when sewage is coming in to the works, while at the other end there is hardly any smell at all.
